moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4: my standard play, against d6: the threat is dxe5, dxe5, Qxd8+, and losing the right to castle...
moves.6... Nf6 7. dxe5: dxe5 is hardly an option: see above comments...
moves.10... O-O 11. Nbd2: the object is clear: trading Ne4...
moves.13... Bh4 14. f3: a convenient tempo: and probably the winning move...
moves.14... Bg6 15. exd6: winning a pawn: Qe8 is not in trouble yet, due to Bh4...
moves.15... Qd8: ??? this is not helpful either: due to Bf4...
moves.16. Nxc6 bxc6 17. dxc7 Qc8 18. Qd6: time to bring in the Queen: Rd8 is no threat...
moves.18... Qb7 19. b3: we look after the little ones...
moves.19... Rac8 20. Kg2: not doing much: maybe preparing trading Bishops, with Bg3...
moves.20... Rxc7: Black cracks under pressure: of course, this is losing...
moves.21. Qxc7: probably the first moment, Black realizes there is a White Bishop at f4...

gameName: May the force be with them...
